issue.title: When strict treat empty string as invalid format for LocalDateDeserializer and LocalDateTimeDeserializer

repository.name: jackson-modules-java8
repository.description: Set of support modules for Java 8 datatypes (Optionals, date/time) and features (parameter names)

issue.body: If 'strict', treat empty string as invalid format, so that LocalDateDeserializer and LocalDateTimeDeserializer report this as an error instead of mapping to null. See issue #114

issue.title: Should not parse `LocalDate`s from number (timestamp) -- or at least should have an option preventing

repository.name: jackson-modules-java8
repository.description: Set of support modules for Java 8 datatypes (Optionals, date/time) and features (parameter names)

issue.body:
In Jackson 2.8.x I had a unit test that parsed the following and expected an exception.

```json
{
  "date": 123,
  "message": "Happy New Year!"
}
```

As of 2.9 related to this commit https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-modules-java8/pull/22/files#diff-a1552641fab3c9690f2c8b0f5ee2fe89R102 it now parses as `1970-05-04`

Is there a way to turn this off if I expect my dates to come in as a different format? I don't want to parse random integers as dates when it should be invalid input.

issue.title: Prevent deserialization of "" as `null` for `Duration`, `Instant`, `LocalTime`, `OffsetTime`, `Period`, `ZoneDateTime`, `ZoneId`, `ZoneOffset` and `YearMonth` in "strict" (non-lenient)

repository.name: jackson-modules-java8
repository.description: Set of support modules for Java 8 datatypes (Optionals, date/time) and features (parameter names)

issue.body:
For the java.time classes Duration, Instant, LocalTime, OffsetDateTime, OffsetTime, Period, ZoneDateTime, ZoneId, ZoneOffset and YearMonth, this fix prevents an empty string from being mapped to null where the "strict" (non-lenient) configuration is set.

See issue #138

body:
Ok, merging to `master` was some work.. .but is done.

I did however uncover one concern: #68 fix was undone by this change (2 tests broke). I think I will just comment out those tests on short term, but need to figure how these settings should work together.
Cool, and I will take a look at #68. Lenient is set by default so empty string should pass through, so probably something else..

I think what happened was more along the lines that I had added new handling in `master`, but due to changes from 2.11, merging, those are overridden. It's fine as nothing is released, and more a question of what should be the overall algorithm for determining acceptance. And not so much a bug introduced.

issue.title: restore fix for parsing of ZoneId that conflicted with changes for issue 138

repository.name: jackson-modules-java8
repository.description: Set of support modules for Java 8 datatypes (Optionals, date/time) and features (parameter names)

issue.body: The empty string handling changes for issue #138 conflicted with the fix for issue #68, so this is to restore the previous fix, where parsing of `ZoneId` should respect `ALLOW_COERCION_OF_SCALARS` wrt empty String
